intro: Chamaecrista parvistipula, commonly known as the small-stippled crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
